Bowling Game

class bowling_game.BowlingGame[source]

Bases: object

This code is for a bowling game, managing the roll history and score calculation.

rolls

A list of how many pins were knocked down during each roll.

Type:

list

current_roll

An index that points to the current roll.

Type:

int

roll(pins)[source]

Records the rolls throughout the game.

Parameters:

pins (int) – The number of pins knocked down in the roll that is currently being rolled.

Puts the roll in the log, and then increments the roll counter for the next roll.

score()[source]

Calculates and returns the total score for the game.

The score is calculated across the entirety of the 10 frames. Each frame consists of a maximum of two rolls, with the exception of the 10th frame, which can contain up to three rolls, depending on if a strike or spare has occurred.

Returns:

The total score for the game.

Return type:

int
